perturbation.original_text: SPONSOR AND EXCITE WILL USE REASONABLE EFFORTS TO ENSURE THE ACCURACY OF THE USAGE REPORTS BUT NEITHER PARTY WARRANTS THAT THE USAGE REPORTS WILL CONFORM TO ANY SPECIFICATIONS AT ANY GIVEN TIME. NEITHER PARTY WILL BE HELD LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIMS AS THEY RELATE TO SUCH USAGE REPORTS, EXCEPT TO THE EXTENT THAT SUCH USAGE REPORTS SERVE AS THE BASIS FOR PAYMENTS UNDER THIS AGREEMENT.
perturbation.changed_text: SPONSOR AND EXCITE will attempt to ensure the accuracy of the usage reports but neither party guarantees the usage reports. Neither party will be held liable for any claims as they relate to such usage reports, except to the extent that such usage reports are the basis for payments under this agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This modification introduces ambiguity by changing 'will use reasonable efforts' to 'will attempt,' weakening the obligation to ensure accuracy. Furthermore, the removal of the phrase 'warrants that the usage reports will conform to any specifications at any given time' makes the expected level of accuracy unclear. By omitting 'reasonable efforts' and replacing 'warrants' with 'guarantees' makes obligations uncertain and unenforceable. This affects New York state's laws regarding fair and accurate business practices.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York General Business Law ยง 349 regarding deceptive acts or practices

perturbation.original_text: Excite will indemnify, defend and hold harmless Sponsor, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants and agents from any and all third party claims, liability, damages and/or costs (including, but not limited to, attorneys fees) arising from the breach of any warranty, representation or covenant in this Agreement. Sponsor will promptly notify Excite of any and all such claims and will reasonably cooperate with Excite with the defense and/or settlement thereof; provided that, if any settlement requires an affirmative obligation of, results in any ongoing liability to or prejudices or detrimentally impacts Sponsor in any way and such obligation, liability, prejudice or impact can reasonably be expected to be material, then such settlement shall require Sponsor's written consent (not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed) and Sponsor may have its own counsel in attendance at all proceedings and substantive negotiations relating to such claim.
perturbation.changed_text: Excite will endeavor to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Sponsor, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants and agents from third party claims, liability, damages and costs (including attorneys fees). Sponsor will promptly notify Excite of such claims and will attempt to cooperate with Excite with the defense and settlement thereof; provided that, if any settlement requires an affirmative obligation of, results in any ongoing liability to or prejudices or detrimentally impacts Sponsor, then such settlement shall require Sponsor's consent.
perturbation.explanation: This modification weakens the indemnity obligations by replacing 'will indemnify, defend and hold harmless' with 'will endeavor to indemnify, defend and hold harmless,' making the obligation less definitive. Replacing 'will reasonably cooperate' with 'will attempt to cooperate' further reduces the certainty of Sponsor's cooperation. Also the removal of phrases such as 'any and all' and 'not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed' makes the clause more open to interpretation. In New York, breach of contract claims require clear and unambiguous obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York law regarding breach of contract and indemnity obligations

perturbation.changed_text: Sponsor shall reasonably indemnify Excite, its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, consultants and agents from third party claims, liability, damages and costs (including attorneys fees) from the breach of any warranty in this agreement. Excite will endeavor to notify Sponsor of such claims and to cooperate with Sponsor with the defense and/or settlement thereof; provided that, if any settlement requires an affirmative obligation of Excite then such settlement shall require Excite's consent.
perturbation.explanation: The original text is modified to create ambiguity in the indemnity clause. 'Sponsor will indemnify' becomes 'Sponsor shall reasonably indemnify' which is less definitive. The phrase 'Any and all' are omitted which makes the section less expansive. 'Excite will promptly notify Sponsor' changes to 'Excite will endeavor to notify Sponsor' weakens the promptness requirement. Furthermore, 'reasonably cooperate' is changed to 'to cooperate'. Such phrases undermine the explicit obligation by introducing loopholes and a degree of discretion, making the obligations difficult to enforce under New York contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: New York contract law regarding indemnity and duty to defend.
